summary:
The North Pole, also called the Geographic North Pole, is where Earth's axis meets the surface in the Northern Hemisphere. It's at 90Â° North latitude and all directions point south. The nearest land is Kaffeklubben Island, Greenland.

The North Pole is in the Arctic Ocean, covered with shifting sea ice. It's hard to build a permanent station there. The first confirmed expedition to reach the North Pole was in 1926 by Roald Amundsen's airship, *Norge*. Later, Soviet and Russian teams reached the Pole on foot and by snowmobile.
title: North Pole
